phrases: Water.
Earth.
Fire.
Air.
Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony.
Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked.
Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them.
But when the world needed him most, he vanished.
A hundred years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar...
And although his airbending skills are great.
He has a lot to learn before he is ready to save anyone.
But I believe Aang can save the world.
Where is Momo?
Hang on Momo!
All right... you too.
This is going to take forever.
That works...
These are Fire Nation traps... you can tell from the metalwork.
We would better pack up camp, and get moving.
Ah-ah... no flying this time.
What?
Why would not we fly?
Think about it.
Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us.
It is because they spot Appa... he is just too noticeable.
What!
Appa's not too noticeable!
He is a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head... it is kind of hard to miss him!
Sokka's just jealous'because he does not have an arrow.
I know you all want to fly,...
Who made you the boss?
I am not the boss...
I am the leader.
You are the leader?
But your voice still cracks!
I am the oldest and I am a warrior.
So... I am the leader!
If anyone's the leader, it is Aang.
I mean, he is the Avatar.
Are you kidding... he is just a goofy kid!
He is right.
Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader?
I bet you would not be so bossy if you kissed a girl.
I-I have kissed a girl... you... just have not met her.
Who?
Gran-gran?
I have met Gran-gran.
No... besides Gran-gran.
Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot...
Okay, we will try it your way Oh Wise Leader.
Who knows... walking might be fun.
Walking stinks!
How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?
I do not know Aang.
Why do not you ask Sokka's instincts... they seem to know everything.
I am tired of carrying this pack.
You know who you should ask to carry it for a while?
Sokka's Instincts!
That is a great idea!
Hey, Sokka's Instincts, would you mind...
Okay, okay...
I get it.
Look guys, I am tired too.
But the important thing is that we are safe from... the... Fire... Nation...
Run!
We are cut off!
Sokka, your shirt!
If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.
What are you doing?
Bluffing?
You?
Promise not to hurt us?
Nice work, Sokka!
How did ya do that?
Uh... instinct?
Look!
Down you go.
They are in the trees!
Hey, he was mine!
Got To be quicker next time.
Man!
Hey.
Hi.
You just took out a whole army almost single-handed!
Army?
Pfft.
There were only, like, twenty guys!
My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters.
Sneers... Longshot... Smellerbee...
The Duke and Pipsqueak.
Pipsqueak... that is a funny name.
You think my name is funny?
It is hilarious.
Um... thanks for saving us Jet.
We were lucky you were there.
I should be thanking you.
We were waiting to ambush those soldiers all morning...
We were relying on instincts.
You will get yourself killed doing that.
Hey Jet... these barrels are filled with blasting jelly.
That is a great score.
And these boxes are filled with jelly candy!
Also good.
Let us not get those mixed up.
We will take the stuff back to the hideout.
You guys have a hideout?
You want to see it?
Yes we want to see it!
We are here.
Where... there is nothing here?!
Hold this.
Why... what is this do?
Aang?
I will get up on my own.
Grab hold of me Katara.
Nice place you got!
It is beautiful up here!
It is beautiful... and more importantly the Fire Nation cannot find us.
They would love to find you.
Would not they, Jet?
It is not going to happen, Smellerbee.
Why does the Fire Nation want to find you?
I guess you could say I have been causing them a little trouble.
See, they took over a nearby Earth Kingdom town a few years back.
We have been ambushin' their troops, cutting off their supply lines,...
One day, we will drive the Fire Nation out of here for good and free that town.
That is so brave.
Yeah, nothing's braver than a guy in a treehouse.
Do not pay any attention to my brother.
No problem.
He probably had a rough day.
So, you all live here?
That is right.
Longshot over there?
His town got burned down by the fire Nation.
And we found the Duke trying to steal our food.
I do not think he ever really had a home.
What about you?
Fire Nation killed my parents.
I was only eight years old.
That day changed me forever.
Sokka and I lost our mother to the Fire Nation.
I am so sorry, Katara.
Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.
I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face,...
Now, the Fire Nation thinks they do not have to worry about a couple of kids...
Or maybe... they are dead wrong!
Hey Jet, nice speech.
Thanks.
By the way, I was really impressed with you and Aang.
That was some great bending I saw out there today.
Well, he is great.
He is the Avatar.
I could use some more training.
Avatar huh?
Very nice.
Thanks Jet.
So I might know a way that you and Aang can help in our struggle.
Unfortunately we have to leave tonight.
Sokka, you are kidding me!
I needed you on an important mission tomorrow.
What mission?
What are you doing?
Shh it amplifies vibrations.
Good trick.
Nothing yet.
Wait!
Yes, someone is approaching.
How many?
I think there is just one.
Good work, Sokka.
Ready your weapon.
Wait!
False alarm... he is just an old man.
What are you doing in our woods, you leech?
Please sir, I am just a traveler.
Do you like destroying towns?
Do you like destroying families?
Do you?!
Oh... please let me go... have mercy...
Does the Fire Nation let people go?!
Does the Fire Nation have mercy?!
Jet, he is just an old man!
He is Fire Nation!
Search him!
But he is not hurting anyone!
Have you forgotten that the Fire Nation killed your mother?
Remember why you fight!
We have got his stuff, Jet.
This does not feel right.
It is what has to be done... now let us get outta here.
Come on Sokka!
Sokka!
Look what the Duke gave me!
Ow!
Quit it!
Hey Sokka.
Is Jet back?
Yeah... he is back.
But we are leaving.
What?
But I made him this hat.
Your boyfriend Jet's a thug.
What?
No, he is not.
He is messed up Katara.
He is not messed up, he is just got a different way of life... a really fun way of life.
He beat and robbed a harmless old man!
I want to hear Jet's side of the story.
Sokka...
No, he conveniently left that part out.
Fine!
But even if he was Fire Nation, he was a harmless civilian.
He was an assassin, Sokka.
See?
There is a compartment for poison in the knife.
He was sent to eliminate me... you helped save my life, Sokka.
I knew there was an explanation.
I did not see any knife!
That is because he was concealing it.
See Sokka?
I am sure you just did not notice the knife.
There was no knife!
I am going back to the hut and packing my things.
Tell me you guys are not leaving yet.
I really need your help.
What can we do?
The Fire Nation is planning on burning down our forest.
If you both use water bending to fill the reservoir, we could fight the fires.
But if you leave now, they will destroy the whole valley.
We cannot leave now with the Fire Nation about to burn down a forest!
I am sorry Katara.
Jet's very smooth, but we cannot trust him.
You know what I think?
You are jealous that he is a better warrior and a better leader!
Katara, I am not jealous of Jet.
It is just that my instinct...
Well my instincts tell me we need to stay here a little longer and help Jet.
Come on Aang.
Sorry Sokka.
Let us go.
Now listen... you are not to blow the dam until I give the signal.
If the reservoir is not full, the Fire Nation troops could survive.
But what about the people in the town... will not they get wiped out too?
Look Duke, that is the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation.
Now do not blow the dam until I give the signal... got it?
Where do you think you are going, ponytail?
Sokka.
I am glad you decided to join us.
I heard your plan to destroy the Earth Kingdom town.
Our plan is to rid the valley of the Fire Nation.
There are people living there Jet... mothers and fathers and children.
We cannot win without making some sacrifices.
You lied to Aang and Katara about the forest fire!
Because they do not understand the demands of war.
Not like you and I do.
I do understand.
I understand that there is nothing you will not do to get what you want.
I was hoping you would have an open mind, but I can see you have made your choice.
I cannot let you warn Katara and Aang.
Take him for a walk... a long walk.
You cannot do this!
Cheer up, Sokka.
We are going to win a great victory against the Fire Nation today.
Jet... I am sorry about how Sokka's been acting.
No worries... he already apologized.
Really?
Sokka apologized?
Yeah...
I was surprised too.
I got the sense that maybe you talked to him or something.
Yeah, I did.
I guess something you said got through to him.
Anyhow, he went out on a scouting mission with Pipsqueak and Smellerbee.
I am glad he cooled off.
He is so stubborn sometimes.
All right, we are here.
Underground water's trying to escape through these vents.
I need you guys to help it along.
I have never used bending on water I cannot see.
I do not know.
Katara.
You can do this.
What about me?
I know the Avatar can do this.
Yes!
Good job!
This river empties into the reservoir... a few more geysers and it will be full.
Look, there is another steam vent.
Okay.
You two keep it up...
I will go check on things at the reservoir.
When we are done we will meet you over there.
Actually... probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you are done.
I bet that is enough... and I am not just saying that to be lazy.
Let us catch up with Jet at the reservoir.
I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout.
Well, we finished early...
I am sure he will be happy to see us.
Come on... move along!
How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?
Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader.
We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay.
If that is how Jet leads, then he is got a lot to learn.
Hey!
While you two are up there you might want to practice your knot-work.
Hey Smellerbee... you going to eat your leechee nuts?
What are they doing?
Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.
Why would they need blasting jelly?
Because Jet's going to blow up the dam.
What?
No... that would destroy the town.
Jet would not do that.
I have got to stop him.
Jet would not do that.
Yes I would.
Jet... why?
Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think.
Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother...
This is not the answer!
I want you to understand me Katara.
I thought your brother would understand, but...
Where is Sokka?
Katara.
I need to get to the dam.
You are not going anywhere without your glider.
I am not going to fight you, Jet.
You will have to if you want your glider back.
Why, Jet?
I cannot believe I trusted you.
You lied to me... you are sick and I trusted you!
What are you doing?
You are too late.
No!
Sokka's still out there... he is our only chance.
Come on, Sokka.
I am sorry I ever doubted you.
Please.
No...
Sokka did not make it in time.
All those people...
Jet... you monster!
This was a victory, Katara.
Remember that.
The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.
It will be safe... without you.
Sokka!
I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.
What!
At first they did not believe me.
The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy.
But one man vouched for me... the old man you attacked.
He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time.
Missus Pretty!
Sokka, you fool!
We could have freed this valley!
Who would be free... everyone would be dead.
You traitor!
No, Jet.
You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.
Katara.
Please... help me.
Goodbye Jet.
Yip yip.
We thought you were going to the dam.
How come you went to the town instead?
Let Me guess... your instincts told you.
Hey... sometimes they are right.
Um... Sokka?
You know we are going the wrong way, right?
And sometimes they are wrong.
